tourBios.carHigh: 2009: Made his first PGA TOUR cut in eight years with a T47 at the 2009 Justin Timberlake Shriners Hospitals for Children Open. After Monday Qualifying, shot final three rounds in the 60s, including a second-round 63, for his first made cut since the 2001 B.C. Open...Made only two cuts in 23 starts on TOUR from 1996-2008. 1986: One of only eight left-handers to win on PGA TOUR (Sam Adams, Bob Charles, Russ Cochran, Phil Mickelson, Mike Weir, Steve Flesch and Eric Axley) when he won the 1986 Pensacola Open. Amateur: Winner 1981, 1982 San Diego County Amateur Match Play Championships; 1983 San Diego County Open (as amateur); 1984-1985 Queen Mary Open.
tourBios.priorYearSeason: Missed the cut in his only two PGA TOUR starts of the season.

tourBios.carHigh: 2011: Played in one event, The Senior Open Championship, where he missed the cut.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Became eligible for the Champions Tour in February 2011. Competed on a full-time basis on the PGA TOUR from 1985-89 as well as in an occasional event from 1990-2010. Best year was in 1986 when he finished 68th on the money list, with $124,548 and three top-10 finishes. One of only nine left-handers to win on PGA TOUR (Sam Adams, Bob Charles, Russ Cochran, Phil Mickelson, Mike Weir, Steve Flesch, Eric Axley and Bubba Watson) when he won the 1986 Pensacola Open. Also won the 1981 and 1982 San Diego County Amateur Match Play Championships and the 1983 San Diego County Open (as an amateur).
